sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The Ephesian and Cimmerian matrons two notable examples of the power of love & wit. Charleton, Walter, 1619-1707.
[13], 80, [26], 77, [5] p.
Printed for Henry Herringman ..., In the Savoy : 1668.
"The Cimmerian matron, to which is added, The mysteries and miracles of love, by P.M. Gent" has special t.p. and separate paging. Written by Walter Charleton. Cf. BM. "The Ephesian matron" sometimes wrongly ascribed to Jeremy Taylor. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Advertisements ([5] p.) at end. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
=======

[13], 80, [26], 77, [5] p.
Printed for Henry Herringman ..., In the Savoy : 1668.
"The Cimmerian matron, to which is added, The mysteries and miracles of love, by P.M. Gent" has special t.p. and separate paging. Written by Walter Charleton. Cf. BM. "The Ephesian matron" sometimes wrongly ascribed to Jeremy Taylor. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Advertisements ([5] p.) at end. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
Henry Herringman
